alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_bounds_factors: ap: ap_bnds b: b_bnds ps: ps
alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: ap: ap b: b ps: ps

dbze.long_name: CloudSat simulator equivalent radar reflectivity factor

depth2000m.long_name: coordinate value for 2000 m ocean depth

depth300m.long_name: coordinate value for 300 m ocean depth

depth700m.long_name: coordinate value for 700 m ocean depth

hybrid_height.z_bounds_factors: a: lev_bnds b: b_bnds orog: orog
hybrid_height.z_factors: a: lev b: b orog: orog

ocean_double_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a href: href k_c: k_c
ocean_double_sigma.z_factors: sigma: sigma depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a_coeff href: href k_c: k_c

ocean_s.formula:
z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i)*(1+s(k)) + depth_c*s(k) + (depth(j,i)-depth_c)*C(k) 
 where 
 C(k)=(1-b)*sinh(a*s(k))/sinh(a) +
           b*(tanh(a*(s(k)+0.5))/(2*tanh(0.5*a)) - 0.5)
ocean_s.z_bounds_factors: s: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth a: a b: b depth_c: depth_c
ocean_s.z_factors: s: lev eta: eta depth: depth a: a_coeff b: b_coeff depth_c: depth_c

ocean_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth
ocean_sigma.z_factors: sigma: lev eta: eta depth: depth

ocean_sigma_z.formula: for k <= nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i) + sigma(k)*(min(depth_c,depth(j,i))+eta(n,j,i)) ; for k > nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = zlev(k)
ocean_sigma_z.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev_bnds
ocean_sigma_z.z_factors: sigma: sigma eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev

smooth_level.z_factors: a: a b1: b1 b2: b2 ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2

standard_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: p0: p0 a: a b: b ps: ps

standard_sigma.z_factors: ptop: ptop sigma: lev ps: ps

time3.long_name: Diurnal cycle: monthly mean of the diurnal cycle (1 hour steps).

ps.comment: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

p0.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: reference pressure

orog.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. Altitude is the (geometric) height above the geoid, which is the reference geopotential surface. The geoid is similar to mean sea level.

depth.long_name: Sea Floor Depth: formula term: thetao

eta.long_name: Sea Surface Height formula term: thetao

ch4.cell_measures: time: mean within years time: mean over years

clivi.comment: Mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

fco2fos.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2
fco2fos.comment: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)

co2.cell_measures: time: mean within years time: mean over years

wap.comment: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)

rsdscs.comment: surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

clt.comment: Total cloud area fraction for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

tasmax.cell_measures: time: maximum within days time: mean over days
tasmax.comment: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: max')

ci.comment: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell.

rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

cli.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. This is calculated as the mass of cloud ice in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. It includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

mc.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell.

n2oglobal.cell_measures: time: mean within years time: mean over years
n2oglobal.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O

tro3.cell_measures: time: mean within years time: mean over years

ccb.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
ccb.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

pfull.cell_measures: time: mean within years time: mean over years

clw.long_name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
clw.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clwvi.comment: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

cfc12global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC12

rsdt.comment: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

cl.comment: Percentage cloud cover, including both large-scale and convective cloud.

rsds.comment: surface solar irradiance for UV calculations

rtmt.long_name: Net Downward Flux at Top of Model
rtmt.comment: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model : I.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.

tauv.comment: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

prc.comment: Convective precipitation at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

evspsbl.comment: Evaporation at surface: flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

hur.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

vas.comment: Northward component of the near surface wind

prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

fco2nat.long_name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources
fco2nat.comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon  that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land (nep) or ocean (fgco2) reservoirs.

ch4global.cell_measures: time: mean within years time: mean over years
ch4global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
ch4global.comment: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4

uas.comment: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

hurs.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

tauu.comment: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

pr.comment: includes both liquid and solid phases

ts.comment: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

cct.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
cct.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

prsn.comment: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

tasmin.cell_measures: time: minimum within days time: mean over days
tasmin.comment: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: min')

phalf.cell_measures: time: mean within years time: mean over years

hcfc22global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22

fco2antt.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2
fco2antt.comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.

cfc113global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC113

sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
sbl.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

n2o.cell_measures: time: mean within years time: mean over years

sci.long_name: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
sci.comment: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.

cfc11global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC11

co2mass.cell_measures: time: mean within years time: mean over years
co2mass.comment: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide
